nwawsoft.util

Class ArrayFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • nwawsoft.util.ArrayFunctions

  • public class ArrayFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Provided functions to create a new Array of any type with a new size. This can bypass the static size of arrays in Java. However, you should really never do this. Using any of this functions means you should have taken a different data structure in the first place.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayFunctions() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Object[] changeArraySize(java.lang.Object[] oldArray, int newSize)
      Returns an Object-Array with the specified size.
      static java.lang.Object[] clear(java.lang.Object[] oldArray)
      Returns an empty Object-Array with the size of the old Array.
      static java.lang.Object[] deleteFirst(java.lang.Object[] oldArray)
      Returns an Object-Array with the size of the old Array - 1.
      static java.lang.Object[] expandArray(java.lang.Object[] oldArray, int additions)
      Returns an array with size oldArray.length+additions.
      static java.lang.Object[] reduceArray(java.lang.Object[] oldArray, int subtractions)
      Returns an array with size oldArray.length-subtractions.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayFunctions

        public ArrayFunctions()

    • Method Detail

      • expandArray

        public static java.lang.Object[] expandArray(java.lang.Object[] oldArray,
                                             int additions)
        Returns an array with size oldArray.length+additions. It contains as much of the old Array's content as possible, starting at index 0 and filling the additional spaces with null.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - an array of any type.
        additions - how many spaces more the new array shall have.
        Returns:
        an array with size oldArray.length+additions which contains as much content of oldArray as possible.

      • reduceArray

        public static java.lang.Object[] reduceArray(java.lang.Object[] oldArray,
                                             int subtractions)
        Returns an array with size oldArray.length-subtractions. It contains as much of the old Array's content as possible.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - an array of any type.
        subtractions - how many spaces less the new array shall have.
        Returns:
        an array with size oldArray.length-subtractions which contains as much content of oldArray as possible.

      • deleteFirst

        public static java.lang.Object[] deleteFirst(java.lang.Object[] oldArray)
        Returns an Object-Array with the size of the old Array - 1. It contains all information of the old Array's except the first content gets deleted. All contents move one position more to the beginning of the Array.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - an array of any type.
        Returns:
        a new array of size oldArray-1 with the contents of oldArray, except for entry oldArray[0].

      • changeArraySize

        public static java.lang.Object[] changeArraySize(java.lang.Object[] oldArray,
                                                 int newSize)
        Returns an Object-Array with the specified size. It contains as much of the old Array's content as possible.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - an array of any type.
        newSize - the size of the new array.
        Returns:
        an array with size newSize and as much content of oldArray as possible.

      • clear

        public static java.lang.Object[] clear(java.lang.Object[] oldArray)
        Returns an empty Object-Array with the size of the old Array.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - an array of any type.
        Returns:
        an empty array with the same size as oldArray.
